== Kubuntu 11.10 to 12.04 LTS Upgrade ==

For upgrading from the most recent LTS release see <nowiki>[[PreciseUpgrades-Kubuntu-10.04LTS]]</nowiki>.

You will need to:
* update your system to the latest 11.10 packages
* reboot
* run the release upgrade tool when notified

=== Upgrade to Kubuntu 12.04 LTS ===

1) Press Alt-F2 and type '''muon-updater'''

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot1.png]]</nowiki>

----

2) Click ''Install updates''

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot4.png]]</nowiki>

----

3) Ensure all the updates get installed

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot3.png]]</nowiki>

----

4) Reboot your computer

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot3.png]]</nowiki>

----

5) After rebooting you should be notified that a new version of Kubuntu is available, click the gear icon

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot5.png]]</nowiki>

----

6) Enter your password<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade2.png]]</nowiki>

----
7) The upgrade tool will start <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade3.png]]</nowiki>

----

8) It will confirm if you want to start the upgrade<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade4.png]]</nowiki>

----

9) It will download and install the new release, have some coffee<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade5.png]]</nowiki>

----

10) It may ask about conf file changes, click '''Replace''' to upgrade<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade9.png]]</nowiki>

----

11) It will ask to confirm removing obsolete packages, click '''Remove'''. <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade10.png]]</nowiki>

----

12) The last step of the entire process is to go ahead and reboot your machine. <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade11.png]]</nowiki>

== Welcome to Kubuntu 12.04 LTS ==
If everything went smoothly after the upgrade and the reboot, your desktop should look like the following: <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:upgrade12.png]]</nowiki>

=== Troubleshooting: ===
If you didn't get notified that and update was available. Check that muon-updater is set to receive "normal" updates.
